channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Littering, 9th August
item.description:

item.title: Disgusting rubbish YET AGAIN, 9th August
item.description:
Rubbish strewn all over the street for the umpteenth time in the past few months. Rodents, foxes and birds eating half rotten food. Disgusting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Whateley Road, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Dead animal: rotting smell & green bottle flys, 9th August
item.description:
We live next door to Minnie Bennett House. Since Thursday there has been a stomach churning smell coming from the garden, by the fence. There are hundreds of green blow flys too, which suggests rotting matter. We think there might be something dead in the garden. The smell is sometimes overpowering when we are in our garden which is next door.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 164, Shooters Hill Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Air bnb tenants seem to misunderstand rules and over fill bins and leave on street where foxes rip up, 9th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Lancaster Mews, Paddington, London

item.title: Fallen Heavy Tree Branch, 9th August
item.description:
A heavy tree branch has fallen from a tree outside 16 Winchester Place, London, N6 5HJ., and is located on the pavement outside number 16 Winchester Place. The tree branch is too heavy to move with ease, and is partially blocking the pavement outside number 16, as well as restricting access to the adjoining parking space. Please can this fallen tree branch be removed? Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Winchester Place, Crouch End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
